column1: Subsequent to both oral and written submissions of all Counsels, this Court overruled the said
The impugned decisions of the Respondents created inter alia;

column2: the compulsory retirement of more than 300 medical specialists in one day,
created  a  lacuna due  to  the  insufficient  number  of  specialist  consultants  to  fill the
posts that would fall vacant upon the retirement of such a large number of specialist
newly  qualified  medical  doctors  are  preparing  for  foreign  licensing  examinations
instead  of  local  postgraduate  examinations  which  indicates  that  many of  them  are
likely to migrate to a foreign country which would further enhance the lacuna present,
a serious impediment to the training of future consultants which was conducted so
far by senior consultant specialists who are now forced to retire at an early age,
